meanings.definition: Serving as a warning or precaution.
meanings.sent1: The cautionary sign alerted hikers of the slippery trail ahead.
meanings.sent2: It's always wise to heed cautionary advice when crossing the street.
meanings.sent3: The cautionary note on the door made everyone giggle before entering.
meanings.sent4: Her cautionary tale about the dangers of procrastination hit home with the students.
meanings.sent5: The cautionary tale of the boy who cried wolf teaches an important lesson about honesty.

meanings.definition: Given as a warning or piece of advice.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's cautionary words about studying for the test were well-received.
meanings.sent2: Parents often give cautionary advice to their children to keep them safe.
meanings.sent3: The cautionary tone in his voice made the situation seem more serious than it was.
meanings.sent4: Her cautionary gesture of shaking her head warned him not to proceed.
meanings.sent5: The cautionary pamphlet provided helpful tips for staying safe during the storm.
